name: Logo Design
body: This is the Sample project of a *Logo Design* process at Exemplary Samples Co.

tasks.name: Design Brief
tasks.body: Design Brief is provided below and available at all times for all stakeholders to review as they see fit.

comments.body: Jamie the Client We may need to bring in someone to help out, but that will have an impact on the current budget. I will make an estimate and get back to you ASAP.
Joshua the Project Manager I am afraid that that is unacceptable. We have a deadline we need to honor, and delays are out of the question. What are our alternatives?
Jamie the Client It seems we've hit a bottle neck. The latest setback has delayed our progress by a week. How will that fact affect your timeline?

Jamie the Client  As a reference, I've created a mood board our designers can use.

Amber the Graphic Designer
I have a few suggestions myself. But instead of jotting it all here, Jamie the Client  please check the Note I made.
Conclusion of online research are provided below.

tasks.name: Project Phase Retrospective
tasks.body:
During the Research phase, we completed three tasks:
1. Moodboard
2. Reference Analysis
3. Online research
Crucial files are provided below, as well as in the Notes section. If you would like to know more, check the Completed Tasks section.
We've spent 24 hours on research.

comments.body: Joshua the Project Manager I understand. This is an excellent approach.
Jamie the Client After successfully completing each phase, we make one task as a phase retrospective. It's meant to will help us recall crucial moments.
Amber the Graphic Designer I am sorry, but this just won't do. You would have to make some radical changes for me to even consider it.
Jamie the Client  First concept is ready. Two more on the way.
Jamie the Client All right, I will get right on it.
Amber the Graphic Designer Indeed we do. It goes perfectly with our brand.
Jamie the Client Starting the second concept, but I just want to reiterate: we stick with red/black/gold color scheme?
Amber the Graphic Designer Maybe black or gray?
Joshua the Project Manager As green grass of the battlefield.
Amber the Graphic Designer Why green?
When it comes to our client company Barbarian's Rags, I am thinking about red, yellow, green palette. Any suggestions?

notes.name: About "Logo Design" Project
notes.body:
We organize our Logo design project in four major stages:

1. Research;
2. Loose Sketching;
3. Tight sketching;
4. Final Refinement;

Each stage is broken down into smaller stages to better organize our time. Usually, our project manager is assigned to "Define the task" stage, as well as a part of "Final refinement stage", while everything else relies on our designer. At the end of every stage, there is a "Client feedback analysis" (which is hidden from clients). Also, we use labels to show which stage each task is in. If there is a necessity for segmenting tasks into smaller pieces we will break it down with subtasks.
Finally, the client is included in the process as it is the fastest way to get feedback.

notes.name: Amber's inspiration for Jamie's company "Barbarian's Rags"
notes.body:
1. Barbarian
- War ------- Chaos
- Raid ------- Fear
- Blood ----- Red
- Loot ------ Rich
- Gold ------ Yellow
- Noise ----- Intrusive

2. Rags
- Used ----------- Ridged edges
- Stained -------- Dark/light same color combo
- Washed out --- Unsaturated
